intro: Viola nepetifolia, commonly known as the common violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom from spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viola nepetifolia is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and along stream banks.
